entry.title: Combined summary - standardize on bitcoin signed ecies ?
entry.summary: The Bitcoin community is considering a proposal to create a standardized PGP-style message that would allow users to send signed encrypted messages using only public and private bitcoin keys. The protocol would enable users to encrypt messages with their private key and decrypt them with their public key, adding an extra layer of security to Bitcoin transactions. However, the proposal has not been implemented yet and remains a topic of discussion within the community. Supporters of the idea believe that it could improve the privacy and security of Bitcoin transactions, while others are skeptical of its usefulness.In 2014, a user named Mem Wallet proposed a similar idea, but using the same keys for signing and encryption is generally considered bad practice for security reasons. Implementing encryption in Bitcoin software has also been difficult and previous attempts have been severely flawed and insecure. The author of the email does not feel confident that a new effort would receive adequate review. In conclusion, while the proposal may have some potential benefits, there are significant security concerns and implementation challenges to be addressed. Nonetheless, the proposal highlights the ongoing efforts to enhance the functionality and security of the Bitcoin network.
